searchTerms.title: Search terms
searchTerms.description: Search for an specific terms and extract tweets for that term.

searchMode.title: Search mode
searchMode.description: Search mode changes the way the data is received

toDate.title: Tweets newer than
toDate.description: Will get tweets that are newer than this date. Can be used in conjunction with 'Tweets older than' to create specific date slices. Can use specific dates, such as YYYY-MM-DD or relative ones, like '1 month' or '2 days'

fromDate.title: Tweets older than
fromDate.description: Will start getting tweets from this date and older. Can be used in conjunction 'Tweets newer than'. Can use specific dates, such as YYYY-MM-DD or relative ones, like '1 month' or '2 days'

tweetsDesired.title: Max. Tweets
tweetsDesired.description: Max. Number of Tweets to Retrieve.

handle.title: List of handles to scrape
handle.description: The twitter handles of the profiles you want to scrape. Shortcut instead of inputting https://twitter.com urls

mode.title: Tweet types
mode.description: Select the tweet types to get. Only tweets or tweets and replies for the selected handle when visiting profiles.
enumTitles: Own tweets and replies to other users

startUrls.title: Start URLs
startUrls.description: If you have a file or a url list of twitter urls, you provide them here

proxyConfig.title: Proxy configuration
proxyConfig.description: Highly recommended to use a proxy.

extendOutputFunction.title: Extend Output Function
extendOutputFunction.description: Add or remove properties on the output object or omit the output returning null

extendScraperFunction.title: Extend Scraper Function
extendScraperFunction.description: Advanced function that allows you to extend the default scraper functionality, allowing you to manually perform actions on the page
extendScraperFunction.prefill:

customData.title: Custom data
customData.description: Any data that you want to have available inside the Extend Output/Scraper Function

initialCookies.title: Login Cookies
initialCookies.description: Your login cookies will be used to bypass the login wall. See ReadMe for instructions.
